title: Sri Lankans braced for price hike at pumps by August
byline: Fuel prices are poised to increase during revisions expected by August because of spikes in the global market as a direct result of the conflict between Israel and Iran, a top official said yesterday.

title: Sri Lankans braced for price hike at pumps by August
byline: Fuel prices are poised to increase during revisions expected by August because of spikes in the global market as a direct result of the conflict between Israel and Iran, a top official said yesterday.

title: Dozens killed by Israeli fire near Gaza aid sites, Hamas-run ministry says
byline: At least 30 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli gunfire near aid distribution sites operated by the US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, the Hamas-run Gaza health ministry said.

title: Trump leaves G7 summit early as Iran-Israel conflict intensifies
byline: US President Donald Trump has cut short his visit to the Group of Seven summit in Canada, with the White House saying he must return to Washington to deal with the escalating conflict between Iran and Israel.

title: Road ahead demands steadfast focus on sustaining reform agenda: CB Governor
byline: Sri Lanka must maintain a firm focus on reforms, private sector empowerment and consistent policymaking, to secure a lasting economic recovery and sustainable debt levels, Central Bank Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said yesterday, cautioning that the country’s transition remains fragile.

title: SC orders NIC recognition for Buddhist Bhikkhuni, citing violation of fundamental rights
byline: In a landmark judgement upholding the right to equal treatment, the Supreme Court, by majority decision yesterday, issued an order directing the Commissioner General of the Department of Registration of Persons to issue a National Identity Card (NIC) to a Buddhist Bhikkhuni, recognising her status as a Bhikkhuni instead of ’’Sil Matha’’.

title: “This time must be different!” IMF First Deputy MD Dr. Gita Gopinath tells SL
byline: Sri Lanka received what can be called a charged address from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) yesterday, which declared that the island nation’s recovery from its worst economic crisis in decades must not be wasted.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy expands 4.8% in 1Q25 on robust industrial activities
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy expanded by 4.8 percent in the first quarter ended in March 2025, extending the recovery, which set off in the third quarter of 2023, the data released from the Census and Statistics Department showed.

title: SL will lay groundwork for a self-reliant economy by 2028: Prez
byline: Sri Lanka would lay the groundwork for a self-reliant economy by 2028, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said yesterday, as the island nation works to break from cycles of economic fragility and external debt dependency.

title: Industrial activities pick up momentum despite slowing in April due to holidays
byline: The industrial heft of the country, measured by the Index of Industrial Production, slipped in April from March, due to factory closures during the traditional new year holidays but the index was up from the same period a year ago, signalling that the activities are regaining strength.

title: Air India’s Ahmedabad-London flight cancelled due to technical snag, same route on which AI-171 crashed
byline: Air India’s AI-159 flight from Ahmedabad to London was cancelled on Monday owing to a technical fault, airline officials confirmed.

title: Colombo ruined by years of corrupt governance: Bimal Ratnayake
byline: Colombo city has deteriorated due to the corrupt municipal administration that has existed for many years, Transport, Highways, Ports and Aviation Minister Bimal Ratnayake said yesterday.

title: ’We had some pretty good battles,’ Rohit Sharma sends message to Mathews
byline: Former India captain Rohit Sharma, who recently stepped away from Test cricket himself, shared a heartfelt message for Sri Lanka’s Angelo Mathews ahead of the veteran all-rounder’s farewell to the longest format.

title: Housemaid of Keheliya granted bail
byline: A woman who had worked as a housemaid for former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella was released on bail in connection with a case involving the misuse of public funds through fraudulent appointments to the Ministry of Health.

title: SJB MPs walk out of Parliament
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) and MP Ravi Karunanayake walked out of Parliament today accusing Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne of acting in a dictatorial manner.

title: Neurosurgeon and clerk at J’pura hospital arrested
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested a specialist neurosurgeon and a clerk attached to the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital.

title: Government not willing to act upon hearsay when it comes to mass graves in North: Justice Minister
byline: Information published about several mass graves in the North are based on hearsay and the government is not willing to act on these without proper information, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara told Parliament today.

title: New bus stand gift for 2026 New Year travellers: Minister
byline: The Transport Ministry is planning to offer passengers a special gift for the Sinhala and Hindu New Year in 2026 the opportunity to travel to their hometowns from a newly renovated central bus stand, Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Ratnayake announced.

title: Sri Lanka’s biggest Rs. 474M lottery prize won
byline: The largest lottery prize in the history of the country’s lottery was claimed yesterday (16) during the National Lottery Board’s Mega Power 2210th draw.

title: NPP’s Kalpitiya PS chairman assaulted
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP)’s Kalpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman and several others were assaulted when the vehicle he was travelling in was attacked at Viruthodai in Madurankuliya last night.

title: Dozens killed by Israeli fire near Gaza aid sites, Hamas-run ministry says
byline: At least 30 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli gunfire near aid distribution sites operated by the US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, the Hamas-run Gaza health ministry said.

title: Cabinet approves draft bill to investigate aircraft accidents in Sri Lanka
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to prepare a draft bill to formally investigate airline crashes and related incidents occurring within Sri Lanka’s territory, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Another Air India Dreamliner flight cancelled
byline: A Delhi-Paris Air India flight, AI 143, has been cancelled for Tuesday after ’’mandatory pre-flight checks identified an issue’’, the airline said in a statement this evening. Consequently, the return service, Air India flight AI 142, scheduled to fly from Paris to Delhi on Wednesday, has also been cancelled.

title: Special fixed deposit scheme for senior citizens
byline: The government has decided to introduce a special fixed deposit scheme for senior citizens, as proposed in the 2025 budget, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Former Deputy GM of Land Reclamation Corp arrested
byline: The former Deputy General Manager of the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation & Development Corporation (SLLRDC) Sujith Priyantha Muthumala has been arrested by the Bribery Commission.

title: Cabinet clears draft bill for Aviation Accident Bureau
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a resolution submitted by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to proceed with the preparation of a revised draft bill to establish an Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau in Sri Lanka.

title: Four Sri Lankans injured in Iran-Israel conflict: Embassy
byline: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel confirmed that four Sri Lankans have been injured in the recent attacks on Israel amidst the ongoing conflict with Iran.

title: Railway Controllers’ Union to launch 48-hour token strike on Friday
byline: The Railway Controllers’ Union announced that it will launch a 48-hour token strike from midnight on Friday (20), protesting the authorities’ failure to address several longstanding issues.

title: Energy Ministry denies rumours of fuel shortage
byline: The Energy Ministry has denied social media reports claiming that the country may face a shortage of fuel due to the ongoing war situation in the Middle East.

title: Guidelines for 2026 education reforms released, teacher training plans underway
byline: The Education Ministry announced that the guidelines for the new education transformation process set to be implemented in 2026 have already been released this August.

title: Heavy rain raises water levels in key reservoirs
byline: Continuous heavy rains experienced in the central hills has resulted in a significant rise in the water levels of the Maussakele and Castlereigh reservoirs.

title: France and Sri Lanka sign bilateral debt restructuring agreement
byline: France and Sri Lanka have today signed a bilateral agreement to implement the recommendations of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Sri Lanka’s debt restructuring, concluded on June 26, 2024.

title: Patients charged up to Rs. 250,000 for hospital-supplied item worth Rs. 17,500 - Bribery Commission
byline: Patients were forced to pay between Rs. 120,000 and Rs. 250,000 for a medical item labelled EVD, used in surgeries at a government hospital in 2022 that had been officially procured and supplied to a government hospital at just Rs. 17,500 (its current market value being around Rs. 46,500), the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) revealed yesterday.

title: Specialist Neurosurgeon at J’Pura hospital remanded
byline: A specialist neurosurgeon at the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital, a management assistant and her employee were ordered to be remanded till June 24 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Harshana Kekunawela, over allegations of corruption.

title: NPP clinches Dehiowita PS chairmanship after 17–17 deadlock
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) secured another key local government win after a 17–17 tie in the Dehiowita Pradeshiya Sabha chairman vote was resolved through a draw of lots.

title: Arrest former chairman of Fisheries Harbour Corporation: Magistrate
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali Jayatunga imposed a travel ban on Sudarshana Fernando, former Chairman of the Ceylon Fisheries Harbour Corporation. The Magistrate also ordered the Immigration Department to arrest the suspect upon arrival in the country.

title: Sri Lanka temporarily halts sending workers to Israel
byline: The Sri Lankan government has temporarily suspended sending workers to Israel due to the current security situation in the region, following an announcement by Israel’s Population and Immigration Authority (PIBA).

title: Centurions Shanto, Rahim run riot in Galle
byline: Tons by skipper Najmil Hossain Shanto and Mushfiqur Rahim saw Bangladesh recover after a shaky start on day one in the first Test match against Sri Lanka played at the Galle International Stadium.

title: NPP reaches understanding with CWC to form local administration in Nuwara-Eliya
byline: The ruling National People’s Power ( NPP) and the Ceylon Workers’ Congress (CWC) have reached an understanding to form the local administration in the Nuwara- Eliya district in places where no single party has a clear majority.

title: Israeli forces kill 51 Palestinians waiting for flour at Gaza aid site, witnesses and rescuers say
byline: Israeli forces have killed more than 51 Palestinians and wounded many more after opening fire near an aid distribution site in southern Gaza, witnesses and rescuers say.

title: The teen who filmed the Air India crash video the world saw
byline: Every time Aryan Asari heard the sound of an airplane, he would go darting out of the house to look for it.

title: UNP’s CMC member assaulted by NPP supporters
byline: UNP’s Colombo Municipal Councillor Sandamali Uluwitage has been hospitalised following an alleged assault by a group of National People’s Power (NPP) supporters last night.

title: Govt. defends WP Commissioner over Colombo mayor vote
byline: The government has refuted allegations that Western Province Local Government Commissioner Sarangika Jayasundara acted arbitrarily during the election of the Colombo Mayor.

title: CSE continues to decline as geopolitical situation in the Middle East worsens
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the day on a negative note, continuing its recent downward trend, with both the All Share Price Index (ASPI) and the S&P SL20 recording declines. During the initial hour of trading, the ASPI showed a gain of nearly 150 points; however, the market reversed course in the latter part of the session, driven by panic selling among investors amid escalating geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

title: Sri Lankan Embassy in Teheran evacuated: Minister
byline: The Sri Lankan Embassy in the Iranian capital of Teheran has been evacuated, Minister of External Affairs Vijitha Herath told Parliament today.

title: Government approves concrete debris recycling project
byline: The government has granted approval to implement a Concrete Debris Recycling Project aimed at recycling concrete and building waste, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Cabinet nod to scrap special benefits for former Presidents and MPs
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to cancel special privileges given to former Presidents and to stop the pension scheme for Members of Parliament after their term of five years.
